Examples of acceptable claim evidence

This information details the minimum evidence required to support the eligible project costs identified in the contract approved for your project.

You can email your evidence, along with your completed claim for payment form, to contractclaims@scotent.co.uk. If you have any questions about your claim, please contact the contract specialist named in your contract.

Evidence link

Supplier/consultant costs

Invoices from a supplier or consultant must clearly show:

  • The total cost of the product or service
  • Any VAT element of the cost separately (VAT costs are ineligible and cannot be included in the claim)

Example:

Invoice example

All invoices from suppliers or consultants must be accompanied by evidence of payment that clearly shows the invoice amount and the name of the supplier/consultant.

Salaries

For projects part-funded by the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF) Programme 2014-2020, you can only claim the salaries of staff who work 100% of their time on approved projects. Paragraph 3.3 of your contract will confirm if your project is ESIF funded or not.
Please note: you can only claim for gross/basic pay; other payments, such as commission or bonuses, cannot be included.

ESIF-funded projects

For each individual salary you claim, you must submit:

  • An employee job description, plus a signed letter from an authorised accountable officer confirming that 100% of this employee's time was spent working on the project.
  • Individual wage slips, or a company payroll listing, which must clearly show the cost breakdown of each individual salary being claimed.

Example:

Wage slip example

Non ESIF-funded projects

For each individual salary you claim, you must submit

  • Individual wage slips, or a company payroll listing, which must clearly show the cost breakdown of each individual salary being claimed.

Examples:

Wage slip example

For staff spending only part of their time working on approved projects, you must also submit:

  • Detailed time sheets (or information from a time recording system) specifying the amount of time spent on the project, which must be signed by the employee and countersigned by their manager/director.

Examples:

Timesheet example

All salary claims must be accompanied by evidence of payment that clearly shows the salary amount and the individual payee.

Please note: If the individual salary payment is part of a bulk Bacs payment (for example, as 'Payroll'), then you must submit both the complete Bacs transaction list and a bank statement. The overall total sum on the transaction list must match the Bacs payment as it appears on your bank statement

Valid evidence of payment:

Bank statement example
Bacs example

Travel and accomodation

Only those costs agreed as eligible (as set out in Schedule 3 of your contract) can be claimed.

Online booking confirmations, receipts or tickets (for example, for travel, accommodation or car hire) must clearly show:

  • The cost, destination or location and the dates of travel, stay or hire.
  • The name of the passenger, guest or driver.

Example:

Booking example

All receipts, tickets and bookings must be accompanied by evidence of payment that clearly shows the amount of the transaction and the name of the payee.

Please note: foreign currency transactions must be converted into GBP for the specific payment date using the European Commission Currency Converter European Commission Currency Converter

Valid evidence of payment:

Bacs example
Bank statement example
Credit card statement example

Evidence of payment

All claims evidence must be accompanied by evidence of payment, such as a bank statement, credit card statement or Bacs statement, which clearly shows that you have paid out the amount you are claiming for.

Company bank statement

Any transactions not relevant to your claim can be redacted (obscured or scored through).

For a bank statement to be fully compliant as evidence of payment, it must:

  • Be a formal statement (either paper copy or online printout), not simply a transaction listing
  • Clearly show the bank name, address and logo
  • Clearly show the account holder's name and details
  • Clearly show relevant transaction dates, amounts and payees that correspond to other evidence, such as invoices, salary payments or receipts.

Example:

Bank statement example

Bacs transaction list

If the costs you are claiming appear as part of a single bulk Bacs payment on your bank statement (for example, as 'Payroll'), then you must submit a Bacs transaction list, as well as a bank statement as evidence of payment. Any transactions not relevant to your claim can be redacted (obscured or scored through).

The Bacs transaction list must:

  • Be clearly identifiable as coming from your payment or payroll system
  • Clearly show individual payees, payment amounts and dates
Please note: The total payment sum and payment date on the transaction list must match the amount and date that appears on your bank statement. Any transactions not relevant to your claim can be redacted (obscured or scored through).

Example:

Bacs example

Credit card statement

Corporate or personal credit card statements can be submitted.

For a credit card statement to be fully compliant as evidence of payment, it must:

  • Be a formal statement (either a paper copy or online print-out), not simply a transaction listing
  • Clearly show the issuer's name, address and logo
  • Clearly show the account holder's name and details
  • Clearly show relevant transaction dates, amounts and payees that correspond to other evidence, such as bookings, invoices or receipts.
Please note: You must also submit a corresponding bank statement showing payment of the relevant credit card transactions, or wage slip/payroll information confirming payment of the transactions as expenses (along with a corresponding Bacs transaction list, if necessary).

Example:

Credit card statement example

Company cheque

For a cheque payment to be fully compliant, you must:

  • Submit a photocopy or scan of the signed cheque, with the cheque number, payee's name and the amount clearly visible.
  • Submit a corresponding bank statement showing the cheque number.

Example:

Company cheque example

Receipted invoice or supplier statement

(only where applicable - service specific)

For a bank statement to be fully compliant as evidence of payment, it must:

  • Be stamped 'paid' or 'received with thanks', with the supplier's company stamp.
  • Be signed by an authorised accountable officer, such as a company secretary, director, partner or authorised signatory.
  • Include the invoice number, payment value, payment date and method of payment.
